New Records: Framber Valdez pitched seven no-hit innings
Key Match Events: Jose Altuve hit a game-ending RBI double in the ninth to lift the Astros to a 3-2 win
Paul DeJong sent a slider from Josh Hader into the Crawford Boxes in left field to tie the game
Bryan Abreu took over to start the eighth and retired Michael Massey on a fly ball before pinch-hitter MJ Melendez grounded out
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Joe Espada emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
The Royals trailed 2-0 and had just one hit when Bobby Witt Jr. reached on an error by shortstop Jeremy Pe√±a to start the ninth
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Joe Espada raved about Framber Valdez's performance
Framber Valdez said through an interpreter that he agreed with the decision to remove him from the game with the no-hitter intact
Manager Matt Quatraro said that Seth Lugo had it all working and that seven innings of one-run baseball against that team is a phenomenal effort
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros took a no-hit bid into the eighth inning for the second time this week
Vinnie Pasquantino will miss the rest of the regular season after breaking his right thumb
RF Kyle Tucker (right shin bruise) took live batting practice Friday for the first time since fouling a ball off his leg June 3
